messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Kelly's cupboard...
messages.msgSnippet: ...sounds a lot like ours :-) Kids know these junk foods exist.  They see them advertised on TV.. They see them prominently displayed in stores.. They see
messages.messageBody:
...sounds a lot like ours :-)

Kids know these "junk" foods exist. They see them advertised on TV.. They
see them prominently displayed in stores.. They see other kids eating
them...They (reasonably) ask for them and want to try them. NOT providing
them only makes the promotions of the commerical world seem even more
enticing. Kids will chose from a variety of foods if a variety is offered.

Teresa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
